content.question: Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are both initially touching the ceiling and are then lowered until they are resting on the floor, as shown. Both spheres have mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, but Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a larger radius than Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes of the changes in the gravitational potential energies, <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> and <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, of the sphere-Earth systems for each sphere when they are lowered from the ceiling to the floor?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1 is less than the absolute value of delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1 equals the absolute value of delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1 is greater than the absolute value of delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>></mo><mo>|</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>
The magnitudes of the changes in the gravitational potential energies cannot be compared without knowing the height of the ceiling.
